Expert Insight: "Effective co-parenting requires open, timely, and respectful communication between both parents to ensure the best outcomes for
their children." - Davidson, H. (2005). The Impact of Domestic Violence on Children: A Report to the President of the American Bar Association.
Research Findings: "Narcissistic parents often manipulate communication platforms to control and limit the targeted parent's involvement,
undermining effective co-parenting and causing emotional distress to the children." - Gottlieb, L. J. (2012). The Parental Alienation Syndrome: A
Family Therapy and Collaborative Systems Approach to Amelioration.

BTW- “Till we get a determination” , I realize you have outsourced your marriage in parenting to a series of lawyers, Susan, James, Annalisa, Natalie,
but on my side, I make the decisions. So no “determination” happens without me. I hope you will consider taking control again. This doesn’t work.

control.

- I wish you well V

Subject:Re: Hangers
Message 3320 of 4024
Got it- Therapy counts as 1-1 visitation time to you.  I disagree but you twist it up as you like.
Then, the next time I see him will be in two weeks. He has expressed concerns to us that I have documented and shared that "Alan" time is not real-
time. So you know that. Given that is the only thing that you are even permitting this summer, is it fair to say that I might not get to have this
conversation mano-mano till there is a parenting plan (Sept?)
Stepping back, you, as a highly educated person, have to be able to see that you have decided unilaterally to be a vigilante parent, unenforceable by
law. You have had 4 lawyers, 6 therapists, and 7 parenting plans. And here we are. You have effectively learned how to "donald trump" family law. It's
unenforceable, just my choice not to be an a-hole about it.
So when can I see my son 1-1 to discuss the trip? That is healthy for him mentally of course.

with me being there just to give him a hug, welcome him home, let him know that I’ve been tracking him, and then send him on his way? It’s a nice
way to show him I care.
Thanks!

May I please just say hello give him a hug and beyond my way . It’s important for us both.

Sent:06/21/2024 at 04:55 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 06/21/2024 at 07:49 PM)
Subject:Re: AD Pick Up
Message 3329 of 4024
I’d love if we could have a two way conversation about the mental health of our kids and doing what is right by them for both of us. So can we have a
one topic conversation about our kids? You keep logging on, shooting arrows and logging off immediately. It’s not helpful.
One is leaving the state. The other is coming back to shore and I won’t see him for two weeks at best except maybe therapy. I had zero say in anything
this summer after being the primary caregiver giver last year across three different countries. Sixty six total days w/o you. The same number of days
without incident.
And in the last two weeks:
- You did not allow me even a hello for his birthday
- You didn’t take him basketball so I missed him there
- You threatened legal action for our phone call
- You would not let me drop gifts off at the mailbox
- You will not permit a welcome home hug from me
- And just now, you asserted you have a plan the allows me zero visits apart from the six supervised hours every two weeks. And that is all I get, period.
I reread the communications. You are incorrect. And it speaks to other options to see him in the same mail. Your assertion is patently false. You know
that.
I am asking you again, please don’t block me from my children or my children from me. Just like his birthday, then his gift dropped at the mailbox, his
basketball games, this hug is simple, harmless, but a small gesture that demonstrates I am there for him. No matter what adult business we have going
on. He sees he is number one, not taking a backseat to personal agendas. I know this is healthy for him.
I think it really comes down to the fact that you believe you are the singular parent to our children and  they are better off with only you instead than
having both of us. I don’t know a single expert, who says that. Please reconsider your total blackout. You were not even in the country for 2.5 months
last year and I did great! After no mishaps- I get nothing?
Please reconsider, this is so small and still so big.
Thanks!

To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 06/21/2024 at 07:49 PM)

Sent:06/21/2024 at 07:52 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 06/22/2024 at 07:19 AM)
Subject:Re: AD Pick Up
Message 3334 of 4024
So... you did your standard drive-by and logged off. Here is what Natalie will tell you:
My stipulation is just a temporary arrangement that outlines supervised visitation with AD, specifying six hours every other Saturday, supervised by
Alan, and includes participation in reunification counseling with Jennifer and me. That is it. Nothing more or less. Done.
It is not a comprehensive residential schedule or a complete parenting plan. It does not provide a detailed weekly or monthly schedule, address legal
custody or decision-making authority, or cover holidays, school vacations, and other important aspects of our children's routine.
You know this gets old and I honestly don't care to make you look bad. And even after all the character assassination that you and your family have
done to me, I'm turning the other cheek. Anything else is, as I have said, not good for our kids. Or even me and you tbh. It's not my style.
Sent:06/21/2024 at 08:34 PM
From:Robert Moyer
To:Christine Moyer (First Viewed: 06/22/2024 at 07:18 AM)
Subject:Re: AD Pick Up

You are not the V, I knew and loved as a great mom for 30 years. Something happened. If you have the occasion to hear me out, I have a very sound
physiological explanation of events from last year. But the nature of your situation is you will never investigate personal shortcomings.
Either way- when you reload for the next drive-by, you can at least see what you signed.
I honestly do wish you well. It's tough talking to the person who took my soulmate away.
Message 3335 of 4024
These messages are not appropriate. I ask you stop.
